thread.title: Cincinnati boxer Adrien Broner goes for WBA Super Lightweight title.
thread.title_full: Cincinnati boxer Adrien Broner goes for WBA Super Lightweight title.

title: Cincinnati boxer Adrien Broner goes for WBA Super Lightweight title.
text:
Cincinnati boxer Adrien Broner goes for WBA Super Lightweight title. 
Updated: Wed, Sep 30 2015, 09:50 PM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC)-- He's a former three-time world champion and this Saturday, Cincinnati's own Adrien Broner looks to add a fourth belt to his collection. 
The 26-year old Broner is facing former world champ Khabib Allakhverdiev who owns a record of 19 and 1-- his only loss coming back in April of 2014 when he lost his WBA Super Lightweight world title to Jessie Vargas in Las Vegas. 
Broner, who owns an impressive record of 30-2 with 22 knockouts, held his final public workout today in Norwood and looked fit and fighting ready for his shot at the title. 
The 12 round fight will be held at the U S Bank Arena and will be televised live on Showtime Championship Boxing at 10pm et. 
Follow us on Twitter @Local12 and LIKE us on Facebook for updates! @bradsteinke Related Stories
